headline: Global Partners (GLP), a Top Stock to Buy Amid the Spike in Oil Prices
summary: Operating one of the largest terminal networks of refined petroleum products in the Northeastern United States, Global Partners (GLP) is an appealing stock to consider amid the sharp spike in crude oil prices.

headline: Oil Prices Drop on Hope for  De-Escalation in Israel-Iran Conflict
summary: The greatest risk the oil markets face is that Iran retaliates against Israel airstrikes by closing the Strait of Hormuz, which is critical to global energy shipments.

headline: Prediction: ExxonMobil Will Increase Its Dividend Every Year Through at Least 2030
summary: ExxonMobil has built one of the strongest businesses in the oil patch.  Historically, they've produced higher total returns with less volatility than companies that don't pay dividends.  Few companies can match ExxonMobil's (NYSE: XOM) dividend growth track record.

headline: Oil Prices Jump After Israel Strikes Iran — 2 Top Energy Stocks to Watch Now
summary: Oil prices are surging following a major Israeli airstrike deep inside Iran, which struck a range of high-value military and nuclear sites – from missile installations to refineries and fuel depots. The escalation has rattled global markets, driving WTI crude futures up by nearly 7% as investors brace for potential supply disruptions and broader regional fallout. In times like these, energy producers with lean, efficient upstream operations and strong capital discipline are in a prime position t
